videos.title: Snowflake's AI Revolution in Sales, Marketing and GTM with Snowflake‘s CMO and Founding CRO
videos.description:
This new episode discusses the impact of AI on marketing and sales at Snowflake. Hosts Chris Degnan, founding CRO of Snowflake, and Denise Persson, CMO at Snowflake, delve into how AI has revolutionized their operations. They share key learnings from Snowflake's data cloud market strategies and their record-breaking IPO.

videos.title: Is The Classic GTM Playbook Really Dead? with SaaStr CEO and Founder Jason Lemkin
videos.description: In this episode, Jason Lemkin, SaaStr CEO and Founder, addresses common misconceptions about traditional go-to-market strategies in the age of AI. Despite claims that outbound marketing, SEO, and old-school tactics are dead, the speaker highlights how leading AI companies are successfully employing these methods with minor tweaks. videos.title: SaaStr's Top 10+ AI Agents: AI SDR, AI BDR, AI RevOps + More: The How, The Who, The Why
videos.description:
Join us in this comprehensive deep dive into the use of AI agents within SaaStr's operations, as requested by many of our followers. 

Led by SaaStr CEO and Founder, Jason Lemkin, and SaaStr Chief AI Officer, Amelia Lerutte, we'll detail our journey from having no AI at the start of the year to utilizing 20 different AI agents, including 11 core ones that we rely on daily.

videos.description:
Join us for an in-depth conversation with Wade Foster, co-founder and CEO of Zapier, on the SaaStr AI Podcast! Wade shares how Zapier is leading the way in AI-powered automation, the evolution from simple workflows to agentic systems, and why AI fluency is now a must-have for every new hire.

videos.description:

In this episode, we swap notes with G2's CMO, Sydney Sloan.

videos.title: 5 Things That Are Working and 5 Things That Aren’t in B2B SaaS AI with Ironclad's CEO and a16z
videos.description:
Ironclad CEO and co-founder Jason Boehmig joined Seema Amble, Partner at Andreessen Horowitz at SaaStr Annual to share their observations on what's currently working – and what's not quite there yet – for Artificial Intelligence (AI) in SaaS. With Ironclad's journey from an AI-first concept in 2014 to a Series E+ company and a16z's extensive portfolio view, their insights offer a valuable perspective on the current state of AI in SaaS.

00:00 Introduction and Speaker Intros
01:29 AI in Onboardin

videos.title: What It Really Takes to Sell To Developers and Engineers with Komodor CRO Jim Hunnewell
videos.description:
Selling to developers and technical audiences requires a different approach than traditional B2B SaaS sales. In a recent SaaStr Workshop Wednesday, Komodor CRO Jim Hunnewell who also previously led sales at companies like GitHub, shared his first-hand experience and insights for successfully selling to engineering teams.

He shares his insights on managing sales at scale, the importance of intellectual curiosity, and understanding one's audience to build trust and ensure successful sales motion.

videos.title: How to Leverage Pricing and Packaging to Drive Revenue with Miro, Loom, OpenAI, and Splunk
videos.description:
Pricing is more than just a number on a contract — when used thoughtfully, it can become a strategic tool for your SaaS product that can drive product adoption, customer satisfaction, and business growth. 

At this year’s SaaStr Annual AI Summit, Akshay Sharma, Head of Pricing and Monetization at Miro, chats with a panel of experts, including Janie Lee, Head of Product at Loom, Alison Harmon, Head of Growth at OpenAI, and Carsten Holm, VP of Pricing and Monetization at Splunk, about their nuance

videos.title: How to Successfully Bring AI Products to Market at Scale with GitHub’s CRO
videos.description:
Join Elizabeth Pemmerl, Chief Revenue Officer at GitHub, as she shares an in-depth look at GitHub's journey with CoPilot and its growth from an internal tool to a widely adopted AI product. 

With nearly a decade of experience at GitHub, Elizabeth discusses the importance of customer feedback, iterative development, and scalable strategies for product and team growth. Learn about the challenges, successes, and key strategies employed at GitHub to reach tens of thousands of organizations and mill

videos.title: Selling Your Startup to Private Equity l Andy Wilson CEO Logikcull and SaaStr CEO Jason Lemkin
videos.description:
Join us in this special edition of SaaStr Workshop Wednesday as Jason Lemkin and Andy Wilson dive deep into the topic of selling your SaaS company to private equity. 

From initial discussions in 2012-2013 to strategic exits and lucrative sales, Andy shares valuable lessons learned from his own journey.

 Key takeaways include the impact of private equity on the SaaS industry, essential tactics for re-accelerating growth, aligning incentives, handling investment bankers, and mastering the deal p

videos.title: Samsara’s Rise to Vertical SaaS Leader and $1B+ ARR with Samsara's CEO and Co-Founder
videos.description:
The Vertical SaaS Rocketship: Samsara's CEO at $1.26 Billion in ARR!

SaaStr CEO and Founder Jason Lemkin has an exclusive conversation with Sanjit Biswas, founder and CEO of Samsara and a two-time entrepreneur with over 20 years of experience. 

Sanjit shares insights on the growth of Samsara, a leading vertical SaaS company that's disrupting the industry by growing 36% and reaching $1.26 billion in ARR. We dive into how Samsara is transforming operations across various fields including fleets,

videos.title: Moving Beyond Traditional Sales, Clay CEO & Co-Founder Kareem Amin on the Future of AI-Driven Growth
videos.description:
Join host Sam Blond in this exciting episode of CRO Confidential as he welcomes Kareem Amin, CEO and co-founder of Clay. 

They dive into how Clay is transforming the way companies approach growth by leveraging data and AI. Kareem shares his journey, from founding Frame, acquired by SailThru, to his time as VP of Product at Wall Street Journal, and now leading Clay. 

The discussion covers the evolution of revenue systems, the role of AI in go-to-market strategies, and how Clay successfully carv

videos.title: What Really Matters in SaaS in 2025 with Jason Lemkin and Dave Kellogg
videos.description:
On the last installment of Workshop Wednesday, where we bring you some of the best SaaStr speakers live with new content and to answer your questions live on Wednesdays— SaaStr CEO and Founder Jason Lemkin and Dave Kellogg, Executive in Residence at Balderton Capital share what really matters in SaaS for 2025.

We delve into 5 key topics in SaaS and cloud for 2025, discussing the future of AI in B2B, strategic pricing changes, the impact of moving customer success to sales, and the state of priv

videos.title: The Top Marketing Strategies for 2025 Growth with the CMOs of Snowflake, LinkedIn, and Carta
videos.description:
Join Carilu Dietrick, CMO and advisor formerly at Atlassian, CMO of Snowflake, Denise Persson, CMO of Carta Nicole Baer, and the VP of Marketing at LinkedIn for Sales, Gail Moody-Byrd as they discuss the complexities and strategies for marketing growth amidst fluctuating metrics and diverse market changes. 

Learn how these leading CMOs tackle challenges like AI integration, category creation, and scaling programs while focusing on customer experience, community building, and leveraging AI for p

videos.title: How to Make Sure You Pick the Right Investors - Advice from SaaStr CEO Jason Lemkin
videos.description:
In our latest video, SaaStr CEO and Founder Jason Lemkin delves into 11 ways you can identify bad investors before signing a term sheet. 

Use this 10-part test to avoid common pitfalls:
#1 Do reference checks
#2 Ask if they write second or third checks
#3 See how many control they want
#4 Figure out their long-term goals
#5 Ask about the lows too
#6 Ask about outside CEOS
#7 What was their worst investment?
#8 Ask what CEO they're a fan of
#9 Should you ask your potential investors to sign an N

videos.title: The State of SaaS Go-to-Market l Theory Ventures General Partner Tomasz Tunguz #saas #b2bsaas
videos.description:
Join us in this insightful episode as seasoned venture capitalist Tomasz Tunguz, General Partner at Theory Ventures shares transformative insights on the current landscape of SaaS Go-To-Market. 

Six months ago, security was the number one prohibition preventing businesses and software companies from buying AI. Today it's ROI. 

In this episode, Tomasz shares nine observations from a Go-To-Market survey Theory Ventures did with hundreds of startups, 68% of them early-stage, well-funded, mostly m

videos.title: Approaching Half a Million Customers: How to Win in SMB | BILL CEO and Founder René Lacerte
videos.description:
Join our in-depth exploration of Bill.com's remarkable evolution, from BILL CEO and Founder René Lacerte and SaaStr CEO and founder Jason Lemkin.
Tune in as they share how BILL has reached half a million customers and $1.3B in revenue.

Together, Jason and René discuss:
*How to sell to multiple stakeholders as a SaaS platform
*Going long and BILL's 20+ year journey to $1B
* Creating a Moat 
* How to create product stickiness 
* The impact of artificial intelligence on BILL

videos.title: The Future of AI and Sales in SaaS with Henry Schuck, CEO of ZoomInfo and SaaStr CEO Jason Lemkin
videos.description:
SaaStr CEO Jason Lemkin joined ZoomInfo's Season 2 of its ZI Labs Podcast as the opening guest alongside ZoomInfo CEO Henry Schuck.

Along with co-host Ben Salzman, Jason and Henry discuss the transformative power of AI within SaaS and the evolving dynamics that are reshaping the landscape of software as a service.

Together they explore the intricacies of scaling SaaS companies, including the importance of recruiting and developing strong management teams, implementing multi-product strategies,

videos.title: The Era of HyperFunctional SaaS is Here l SaaStr CEO and Founder Jason Lemkin
videos.description:
SaaStr CEO and Founder Jason Lemkin explains why the new era of hyper-functional SaaS is here, and how it's reshaping the landscape of SaaS companies.

Key topics include the critical role of AI and automation in meeting rising customer expectations and the imperative for tech companies to develop multi-product strategies to sustain growth. We explore how companies like Samsara, Slice, Datadog, and Monday are navigating market dynamics, balancing efficiency with innovation, and adapting to accel

videos.title: State of the Cloud: The Cloud AI Era with Bessemer Venture Partners
videos.description:
Bessemer Venture Partners is committing $1 billion in capital to back AI-native companies and founders at the bleeding edge. 

Sameer Dholakia, Partner at Bessemer Venture Partners speaks with Julia Chapin, COO at Abridge, Kate Jensen, Head of Revenue at Anthropic, Rami Karabibar, CEO and founder at EvenUp, and Timothy Young, CEO at Jasper, on the impacts of AI on the State of the Cloud. 

The discussion delves into the integration of AI into SaaS, marketing, healthcare, and legal industries, wi

videos.title: The Secrets to Selling and Scaling in Vertical SaaS with Slice's CRO
videos.description:
Loren Padelford, CRO of Slice and previously SVP and GM of Shopify Plus, does a deep dive with the SaaStr CEO and Founder Jason Lemkin on the top learnings selling to SMBs and within Vertical SaaS.

The conversation dives into Slice's approach of helping independent pizzerias by offering integrated software and services, comparing it to the approach of Domino's. Lauren offers lessons learned during his career in SaaS, with inspirational views on growth strategies, customer focus, and building tr

videos.title: Why Klaviyo is the $1B ARR SaaS Company You Don't Know Yet with CEO and Co-Founder Andrew Bialecki
videos.description:
Klaviyo is the most awesome SaaS company you don't know enough about yet. :) 

Join SaaStr CEO and Founder Jason Lemkin and Klaviyo CEO and Co-Founder, Andrew Bialecki as they discuss Klaviyo's rise as a leading marketing and customer data platform for B2C businesses. 

Discover the strategies behind its growth, the challenges faced in expansion, the pivotal partnership with Shopify, and insights into successfully navigating the journey from SMBs to enterprise markets. Learn about the company's

videos.title: The Revenue Playbook: Rippling’s Top 3 Growth Tactics at Scale with Rippling CRO Matt Plank
videos.description:
At this year’s SaaStr Annual, Rippling's CRO, Matt Plank, chats with Sam Blond, host of the SaaStr CRO Confidential and former CRO at Brex, about Rippling’s top 3 growth tactics, which have led to the Rippling becoming a $14B company with hundreds of millions of ARR. The three growth tactics that worked for Rippling can be categorized into three different stages:

videos.title: 5 Metrics that Matter When Raising Your SaaS Series A and Series B with Christoph Janz of Point 9

videos.title: Why Vertical SaaS is Booming, And How to Get 110% NRR from SMBs, with Jason Lemkin + Mangomint's CEO
videos.description:
Vertical SaaS seems to be mostly immune from any “macro downturn”.  Is taht what you are seeing?  Why?

We all can’t hire anyone these days. We’re out of people to work.   How does automation and AI play into this for SMBs and in labor-constrained environments? 

Many SMB vertical SaaS leaders seem to be converging on a Toast-like stack:  POS, SaaS, payments, payroll, and more.  What’s driving that?  Can you compete with just a piece?

You have 110%+ NRR from SMBs.  What’s the trick and learning

videos.description:
Grafana Labs Origin Story

Grafana Labs started as an open-source project back in 2014 with three co-founders, including Raj. 

Building Culture as a Remote First Company

With 1,200 people working at Grafana Labs, how do you build a culture? It’s definitely harder, but if you’re remote-first, you can build a culture that’s purpose-built to be remote.

If you’re remote-friendly, the pattern many people get into is that the remote employee has a second-class career. They aren’t part of the water

videos.title: Fundraising from VCs and Hiring VPs in 2025: AMA with Jason Lemkin SaaStr CEO
videos.description:
To close out SaaStr Europa, Jason Lemkin, SaaStr CEO and Founder took the stage to answer the audience's most burning questions. AMA’s with Jason are wildly popular for his expertise and no-holds-barred delivery. 

Jason gives his advice on the following topics:
*Hiring in 2025 and Beyond

videos.title: Top 10 Go To Market Mistakes Founders Make Again … and Again with SaaStr’s Jason Lemkin
videos.description:
What are the biggest GTM (Go To Market) mistakes founders make? 

SaaStr CEO and Founder Jason Lemkin shares The Top 10 Go To Market (Sales & Marketing & Revenue) Mistakes Founders Make Again and Again. Some are decades-old problems, while others have emerged from this new world we’re in. Let’s jump right in.

1. Hire a VP of Sales that can sell or demo the product
2. Hire a VP of Marketing who can do demand generation
3. As a Founder or CEO, stay in sales
4. Don't cut your marketing budgets to

SaaStr CEO and Founder Jason Lemkin reflects on the SaaS industry's journey over the past several years, particularly focusing on the challenges and growth seen in 2022 and 2023.

Jason's best advice?

"Just build."

1. Don’t Outsource Recruiting
2. Focus on Demand Until You Have Too Much

videos.title: René Lacerte, CEO Bill + Jason Lemkin: "It's Just Getting Good for SMB SaaS"
videos.description:
My Top 10 Learnings from Rene Lacerte, CEO Founder of Bill:

#1.  You can’t rush a network.  

Bill.com had to develop a network that today has millions on vendors processing bills and payments on it.  But they couldn’t rush it.  So they let folks use the platform the way they wanted, from paper checks to fax and more.

#2.  You can’t always rush a fintech product.  

The payments / fintech side of Bill took a decade to come together.  It was much more than adding an API, especially at scale.  R
